column5: A Tale of Two Cities is a novel by Charles Dickens set in London and Paris before and during the French Revolution.
Gone with the Wind is a novel written by Margaret Mitchell. It was published in 1936. The story is set in Clayton County and Atlanta during the American Civil War and Reconstruction Era.
Pride and Prejudice is a novel by Jane Austen.  It was first published in 1813. The story follows the main character Elizabeth Bennet.
